description: Dreaming big is in our DNA. It’s who we are as a company. It’s our culture. It’s our heritage. And more than ever, it’s our future. A future where we’re always looking forward. Always serving up new ways to meet life’s moments. A future where we keep dreaming bigger. We look for people with passion, talent, and curiosity, and provide them with the teammates, resources and opportunities to unleash their full potential. The power we create together – when we combine your strengths with ours – is unstoppable. Are you ready to join a team that dreams as big as you do? SALARY RANGE: $83,000 - $95,000 per year + bonus potential JOB DESCRIPTION: Devils Backbone and Cisco Brewery are looking for a Brand Manager – Research and Analytics, responsible for supporting Devils Backbone and Cisco Brewery Brands, with a focus on market research and analytics, digital marketing and project management. Successful applicants will show an understanding of the consumer package goods space, marketing technology, data analysis and visualizations, and work closely with all departments to ensure that brands are appropriately supported. JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: Support the Marketing Director to develop, recommend, and lead the execution of the marketing strategy as well as manage the effective deployment of the marketing budget. Analyze internal marketing and commercial performance data and recommend actions to be taken. Analyze brands and competitive trends and recommend actions to be taken. Develop creative briefs that align with brand strategy and values-based brand proposition for certain creative projects. Provide ongoing collaboration, creative input, and design projects with internal and external partners. Ensures ideas and concepts align with marketing objectives and are completed by timelines. Create and shape brand messaging and communication of new brand offerings. Aid in the development and own the execution of the marketing plan and materials based on market insights. Manage performance of Cisco brand team, holding team accountable for assigned responsibilities and projects. POC for all brand marketing research and analytics SKILLS AND ABILITIES: Excellent organization, communication, and project management skills. Strong strategic, analytic, financial, and consumer research skills. Working knowledge of the craft beer and distilled spirits industry helpful. Understanding of the selling process, retail environment, and distribution network. Creative problem solver who is able to be collaborative with a diverse cross-functional team. Strategic thinker who is able to articulate the brand vision, as well as anticipate and identify consumer needs. Familiarity with SQL, Python, and advanced Data Visualization Tools, including power BI, Tableau. Ability to frequently sit, stoop, kneel or crouch. On occasion the employee must lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Some night and weekend travel required: 5-10% EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor’s degree in marketing, communications, advertising, economics, statistics, data science or related field needed - required. 3 years of marketing experience in Brand Marketing or Marketing Analytics. BENEFITS: Competitive salary Paid company holiday Paid vacation and sick time off Medical, dental & vision insurance available immediately Employer paid short term disability 401K up to 6% match Generous parental leave options Uniforms & PPE provided, based on position Safety shoes allowance, based on position Learning & development opportunities Employee discounts at restaurant locations Employee discounts on merchandise Relocation assistance available BEER! ABOUT BREWERS COLLECTIVE: Anheuser-Busch's craft brewery partners are advancing the beer category by bringing together a shared commitment to quality, innovation, and communities with a mission to energize how people view, consume and experience beer. We share an unwavering devotion to the authentic origins of each brewery, the beer, and the communities they serve. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran and require a reasonable accommodation to complete the application process, please contact us at CraftPeople@brewerscollective.com PRIVACY POLICY TERMS AND CONDITIONS EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYMENT PAY TRANSPARENCY POLICY STATEMENT
